translation: Hi, everyone.
transcript: 大家好。

translation: Look at this old man on the screen.
transcript: 屏幕上这位老者。

translation: Do you know what his occupation is?
transcript: 大家知道他的职业是什么吗？

translation: Well, if you ask me, my answer is that he is a detective.
transcript: 今天我要告诉大家，这个人的职业是侦探。

translation: Those of you who major in biology may find this answer ridiculous.
transcript: 呃学生物的同学你不要笑。

translation: Well, I call him the most famous private detective in the world because he discovered that "God created man" was a huge lie.
transcript: 呃他是世界世上最有名的私家侦探，他发现了“上帝造人是一个谎言”这样一个天大的秘密。

translation: We all know his name is Charles Darwin.
transcript: 我们知道这个人是查尔斯•达尔文。

translation: He is a famous British naturalist and the founder of Darwinism.
transcript: 他是英国著名的博物学家，是进化论之父。

translation: He had numerous well known publications, of which, On the Origins of Species is the most widely known one and has exerted far-reaching influence.
transcript: 他的一生中有非常多的著作，其中最为出名的，就是那个大家都非常熟悉的，影响力最为广泛的《物种起源》。

translation: On the Origins of Species was published in 1859 and is nearly one hundred and sixty years old.
transcript: 《物种起源》发表于1859年，距今已经有接近一百六十年的历史。

translation: Up to present, both the public and scientists still have various misunderstandings about the book, the author and his theory of evolution.
transcript: 但是到现在为止，无论是公众，还是科学家，一直都会对达尔文的《物种起源》，达尔文及其进化论，有着各种各样的误解。

translation: When I was in graduate school.
transcript: 我在读研究生的时候。

translation: One student who was studying evolution went to the professor and asked for advice on his essay.
transcript: 我们一位学进化的师兄，有一次去问我们的老师，说老师，你帮我看看我这篇文章。

translation: The professor asked him, "I saw a citation of On the Origin of Species in your first chapter, have you read it?"
transcript: 老师就问他，说，我看到了你第一篇就引了《物种起源》，你有没有看过？

translation: He replied, "Yes, I have."
transcript: 他说，看过啊。

translation: The professor went on and asked, "In that case, can you tell me what is the first chapter?"
transcript: 老师说，既然你看过，那么你能告诉我，《物种起源》的第一章是什么吗？

translation: I believe many of you have read On the Origin of Species.
transcript: 我相信很多人都看过《物种起源》。

translation: But lots of people don't know what the first chapter is.
transcript: 但是很多人不知道《物种起源》的第一章是什么。

translation: The first chapter of On the Origin of Species is "Variation under Domestication".
transcript: 《物种起源》的第一章是，家养条件下的变异。

translation: Some people do know that the first chapter of the book is "Variation under Domestication".
transcript: 有很多人知道家养条件下的变异是达尔文设立的第一章。

translation: But most of them do not understand why Darwin chose to begin the book with this chapter.
transcript: 但是他不知道为什么达尔文把它作为一个非常重要的一个开端。

translation: In fact, there is an important scientific question involved.
transcript: 其实这里头蕴含着很重要的科学问题。

translation: As we know that Darwin had a precious chance of going on a voyage on the Beagle.
transcript: 我们知道，达尔文年轻的时候，曾经有过一次非常非常难得的贝格尔号环球旅行的机会。

translation: At the beginning of the voyage, he was a student fresh out of a seminary.
transcript: 在登上船的时候，他还是一个神学院走出来的学生。

translation: He would quote "God" every time he spoke and was thus mocked by the sailors a lot.
transcript: 每次都言必称“上帝”，所以当时的水手还经常嘲笑他。

translation: However, during the five years of sailing on the Beagle.
transcript: 但是，经过五年的贝格尔号航行。

translation: He collected numerous specimens of animals and plants and did extensive geological surveys.
transcript: 他采集了大量的动植物的标本，还有进行了广泛的地质考察。

translation: He traveled to many places.
transcript: 他在很多地方留下了他的足迹。

translation: He saw turtles, iguanas, and ground finch in the Galapagos Islands near South America and many fossils in other places.
transcript: 特别是在南美附近的加拉帕戈斯群岛，他见到了象龟、鬣蜥、地雀，还有其他的地方，他见到了大量的化石。

translation: These experiences challenged his view that "all living species were created separately by God" and led him to see the absurdity in it.
transcript: 这些东西的发现，让他非常深刻地认识到，他心目中原有的一个理论，就是“物种是上帝分别创造的”，那是非常荒谬的。

translation: Darwin thought if he wanted to propose another explanation about the origins of species.
transcript: 达尔文想，如果我要是去告诉别人，物种是如何起源的。

translation: He first had to explain how the species evolved.
transcript: 那么他就必须先解决一个问题，他首先就要让大家知道物种是变的。

translation: At that time, almost everyone believed that there were fixed kinds of species, as many kinds as God had created.
transcript: 在当时的情况下，所有的人几乎都相信物种是不变的，上帝创造了多少个物种，就有多少个物种。

translation: Darwin had seen abundant living evidences himself, but it would be extremely difficult to persuade the others.
transcript: 达尔文自己是看到了很多鲜活的证据，但是，他如果想要让其他的人也相信，呃非常的困难。

translation: So, he thought the best way is to start with the domestic animals familiar to the average people.
transcript: 所以他想到，我如果要做这样的解释，最好的办法就是让大家所熟悉的家养的动物开始。

translation: At Darwin's time, pigeons were widely loved and training pigeons was very popular.
transcript: 在达尔文那个时期，鸽子是大家非常喜欢的动物，有很多人在训鸽。

translation: Among all the varieties of pigeons, British homing pigeon and pouter are observably different.
transcript: 那么在鸽子中，就可以看到，像英国的信鸽，还有球胸鸽，这两种是非常非常不同的类型。

translation: We can see that the homing pigeons have twisted mouths.
transcript: 你可以看到，英国的信鸽嘴不好，长得有点儿歪。

translation: The pouters have disproportionally large chests, a kind of malformation.
transcript: 球胸鸽胸部比较大，是严重的畸形。

translation: You might think they are two species if not told.
transcript: 那么这两种生物，如果我们不告诉你，你可能会认为就是两个物种。

translation: However, they were all domesticated from wild rock pigeons.
transcript: 但是他们都是由野生岩鸽驯化而来的。

translation: Wild rock pigeons can also be domesticated into other varieties.
transcript: 野生岩鸽，还可以驯化出其他不同的类型。

translation: Nowadays, people do not find pigeons interesting any more.
transcript: 现在的人，对鸽子呢没有什么太多的兴趣。

translation: But Darwin prepared us with other more relevant examples, such as dogs, horses, cattle, etc.
transcript: 那么达尔文呢他也给你准备了很多其他的例子，比如说狗啊，马呀，牛哇等等。

translation: Darwin suggested that the blood of wild species of Canidae, sometimes mingled together, flows in the veins of our domestic dog breeds.
transcript: 达尔文说：“狗的血管中流淌着犬类动物混杂的血液”。

translation: What did he mean?
transcript: 什么意思呢？

translation: Put simply, he was saying, "Dogs are mixed-breed."
transcript: 如果大家把这个翻译成白话文，就是说“狗是杂交来的”。

translation: The existing science has proven that dogs are descendants of wolves and they don't have a separate branch.
transcript: 现在的科学已经证明，狗起源于狼，狗没有一个独立的分支。

translation: In the evolutionary history of dogs, hybridization does occur frequently.
transcript: 而且狗的进化历史上，确实是出现了多次频繁的杂交。

translation: Therefore, using the variation in domestic breeds as example.
transcript: 所以，我们我们知道，达尔文他通过家养条件下的变异。

translation: Darwin was able to persuade the others that species were evolving.
transcript: 那他就能够很好地让大家知道，物种是变的。

translation: Darwin did his research in a progressive approach, from variation under domestication to variation in nature, from explicit to implicit and from easy to hard.
transcript: 达尔文从家养条件下的变异入手，再延伸到自然条件下的变异，这个呢，是由显入微、由易入难。

translation: This is in line with how we acquire new knowledge.
transcript: 非常非常符合我们大家认识事物的一个基本的规律。

translation: This is why Darwin chose to start the book with this chapter. It was very wise of him to do so.
transcript: 这是达尔文非常睿智的地方，也就是刚才我们提到达尔文为什么要把这个放到第一章。

translation: On the Origin of Species involves information in different aspects.
transcript: 大家知道，达尔文的《物种起源》这本书，它涉及到了很多很多个方面。

translation: Naturally, it was widely questioned and misunderstood in various ways.
transcript: 那么大家的质疑呢，也就会非常非常的多，引起的误解呢，有各种各样的类型。

translation: We will address some of the most common misunderstandings through three questions.
transcript: 其中最典型的类型，我们今天通过三个问题来给大家进行分析。

translation: The first question, as the argument "evolution by natural selection and survival of the fittest" goes.
transcript: 第一个问题，我们通常都在说，“物竞天择、适者生存”。

translation: Should we just obey the law of the jungle and value the idea that only the strongest could survive?
transcript: 那么我们是不是就应该崇崇尚丛林法则，强调弱肉强食呢？

translation: Second one, did humans descend from apes?
transcript: 第二个，人到底是不是由猿猴变来的？

translation: If not, then what is their relationship?
transcript: 如果不是的话，那么人和猿究竟是一个什么样的关系？

translation: The last question is that, published nearly 160 years ago, has On the Origin of Species become obsolete?
transcript: 还有，最后一个问题是《物种起源》已经发表了接近160年，这么长的时间过去了，那么，达尔文的进化论是不是过时了？

translation: To answer such questions.
transcript: 要回答这样的问题。

translation: We must have a basic understanding about the theory of evolution.
transcript: 那么呢，我们必须要了解，一些关于进化论。

translation: Especially those in On the Origin of Species.
transcript: 尤其是《物种起源》的一些最基本的知识。

translation: This understanding comes down to three aspects.
transcript: 那么这些知识，实际上说起来就是三个方面。

translation: The first aspects is about the core of Darwin's principles of natural selection.
transcript: 一个方面呢，是关于达尔文他的自然选择学说的一个最核心的部分是什么。

translation: The second aspect studies the influence exerted on biology and science at large.
transcript: 第二个方面，就是他对整个的生物学界，甚至整个的科学界，他有什么样的一个深远的影响。

translation: The third is to observe the developments the later biologists and scientists have made based on his theories.
transcript: 再就是，未来的这些科学家们，进化生物学家们，对他的学说有什么样的一个发展。

translation: The book can be divided into three parts.
transcript: 《物种起源》它的基本构成，就讲了三个部分。

translation: The establishment of the principles of natural selection, the difficulties of the theory of evolution and the possible solutions, and the theoretical underpinnings of it.
transcript: 就是自然选择学说的建立，这个进化学说的难点、如何化解，第三个部分，那就是涉及到的一些相关理论的支撑。

translation: The key component is the development of natural selection.
transcript: 最核心的部分，是自然选择学说的建立。

translation: Variation under domestication or that in nature all suggest that variation is universal.
transcript: 无论是家养条件下的变异，还是自然条件下的变异，讲的就是一个问题，讲的就是变异是普遍存在的。

translation: However, variation alone cannot account for the origins of species.
transcript: 有了这个变异，并不能够说明物种是如何起源的。

translation: Therefore, the variation must have a certain amount.
transcript: 所以呢，变异一定要有一定的量。

translation: In the chapter of "Struggle for Existence".
transcript: 那达尔文在生存斗争这一部分。

translation: Darwin said that all species has the potential for exponential growth or overbreeding.
transcript: 他其实讲是任何一个物种它都有一个指数增长的一个变化趋势，也就是说过度繁殖。

translation: However, why didn't all species survive?
transcript: 但是为什么，没有那么多物种存下来呢？

translation: It is because of the struggle for survival.
transcript: 是由于生存斗争。

translation: Only species or variations that is fit to survival can be kept.
transcript: 由于生存斗争，那么只有那些有利于生存的个体或者是变异，能够被保留下来。

translation: Those unfit for survival are phased out.
transcript: 其他的，那些不利的，就会被淘汰。

translation: This is called natural selection or survival of the fittest.
transcript: 这就是我们通常所说的，自然选择，也叫做适者生存。

translation: In this part, Darwin obviously borrowed the population theory of Malthus.
transcript: 达尔文在讲这一个部分的时候，其实他很明显的是用到了马尔萨斯的人口论。

translation: On the chart with a dark background, we can see a red curve.
transcript: 我们在这个黑底的图上，可以看到有一根红色的曲线。

translation: This red curve represents the potential of infinite exponential growth trend of each species.
transcript: 这个红色的曲线就是讲，每一种生物都具有无限指数增长的趋势。

translation: However, reality is cruel.
transcript: 但是现实是非常残酷的。

translation: Due to environmental changes, food shortages, predation by natural enemies, etc., virtually no species can grow indefinitely or exponentially.
transcript: 由于环境的变迁、食物的短缺、天敌的捕食等等等等因素，事实上任何一种生物都不是无限指数地增长。

translation: The actual growth pattern is a s-shaped curve like the blue one.
transcript: 而是蓝色曲线那样的一个S型的曲线。

translation: In addition, it has a definite peak, a limit.
transcript: 而且它有一个明显的高峰峰值，达到一个上限。

translation: The example given by Darwin is about elephant.
transcript: 达尔文给我们的例子是。

translation: Suppose an elephant can live for 100 years, and each couple have 6 babies.
transcript: 假设大象能活一百年，一对儿大象呢，能够生六胎的话。

translation: Then how many offsprings will the entire group of elephants produce after 750 years?
transcript: 那么经过750年，整个的大象，就能够产生多少后代呢？

translation: 19 million heads.
It is unrealistic.
transcript: 那么多后代，怎么可能？

translation: Due to the struggle for existence and natural selection, how many elephants there are now?
transcript: 由于生存斗争，由于自然选择，你现在见到多少大象？

translation: Very few.
transcript: 非常非常之少。

translation: We may think this is because of natural selection and survival of the fittest.
transcript: 这样大家就会想到，哦，这个应该是物竞天择，适者生存。

translation: In fact, the translation of "natural selection" and "survival of the fittest" did not come from Darwin's On the Origin of Species, but from Yan Fu's Evolution of Heaven.
transcript: 说起“物竞天择”和“适者生存”，这句话并不是出自达尔文的《物种起源》，它是严复翻译的《天演论》中的句子。

translation: The Evolution of Heaven was not translated from Darwin's On the Origin of Species but Huxley's Evolution and Ethics.
transcript: 《天演论》呢，又不是翻译自达尔文的《物种起源》，他翻译的是赫胥黎的《进化论和伦理学》。

translation: When Yan Fu was translating this work, he added his own understanding.
transcript: 严复在翻译这个著作的时候，他又加入了自己的理解，所以就变成了现在这个样子。

translation: Is there any beneficial impact?
transcript: 这个有没有好处呢？

translation: Yes.
transcript: 有。

translation: The most beneficial impact is that it accelerated the cause of revolution in China.
transcript: 他最大的好处是，推动了中国革命的积极进步。

translation: We now talk about "survival of the fittest", but in the first version of the book, the term used by Darwin was "natural selection".
transcript: 我们讲到“适者生存”，在达尔文最达尔文《物种起源》的最早初版本里，他就是用的自然选择。

translation: Survival of the fittest does not equal to survival of the strongest.
transcript: 适者生存，并不等同于强者生存。

translation: When we talk about the survival of the fittest, we are speaking in a relative sense.
transcript: 即使是我们通常所说的优胜劣汰，优和劣，也是相对的。

translation: Let us see another example.
transcript: 我们再给大家举个例子。

translation: Tigers rank higher than rabbits on the food chain, tigers feed on rabbits, so in this sense we can say that the tiger is the stronger of the two.
transcript: 比如说兔子和老虎，在食物链食物链儿的这个关系上，那老虎要吃兔子，我们说老虎是强者，兔子一定是弱者。

translation: But in terms of fertility, rabbits have a comparative advantage.
transcript: 但是在生育能力上，兔子远远地比老虎要强。

translation: They breed very fast while the tiger litters consist of only two or three cubs.
transcript: 它繁殖非常得快，老虎呢一胎两三只。

translation: We know tigers rather than rabbits are endangered.
transcript: 所以大家经常能看到的现象，是老虎先灭绝了。

translation: So which are stronger, tigers or rabbits?
transcript: 所以说，到底是兔子是优呢，还是老虎是优呢？

translation: There is no absolute answer in this sense.
transcript: 相对的。

translation: During the publishing of On the Origin of Species, Darwin needed to rest a lot due to his poor health.
transcript: 在达尔文《物种起源》发表的过程中，由于他的身体非常的不好，他经常需要休息。

translation: Therefore, many of his followers promoted the book for him in different places.
transcript: 所以呢，有很多不同的支持者，就会把他的理念推广到各个地方去。

translation: But some supporters had their own interpretation towards the theory.
transcript: 他的支持派中，是鱼龙混杂的。

translation: Among whom there were Spencer, an advocator of social Darwinism and the creator of the expression "survival of the fittest", and Galton, the founder of eugenics.
transcript: 其中，社会达尔文主义的典型代表，也就是“适者生存”的那个名词的创造者斯宾塞，还有优生学的代表高尔登。

translation: Galton was Darwin' cousin.
transcript: 高尔登这个人呢，是达尔文的表弟。

translation: He was brilliant and was the founder of eugenics.
transcript: 非常非常的厉害，他创造了优生学。

translation: These two people applied Darwin's principles of natural selection to human society in a direct and simplistic way.
transcript: 这两个人，就直接地、简单地把达尔文的自然选择学说，用于了人类社会事物。

translation: They believed in the survival of the more competitive in human society and those that were weak should be phased out.
transcript: 他们认为，这个人类社会呀，应该优胜劣汰。

translation: That is to say, we should not protect and sympathize the weak.
transcript: 既然是这样，那么我们就不应该保护和同情那些弱者。

translation: However, Darwin did not think so.
transcript: 告诉大家，达尔文不是这么想的。

translation: In The Descent of Man and Selection In Relation To Sex.
transcript: 达尔文在他的《人类的起源》一书中。

translation: Darwin categorically opposed to a simplistic application of this theory to human society.
transcript: 他非常明确地反对简单化地把这个选择理论用于人类事物。

translation: He believes that we should sympathize with the weak and help them, as this is the demonstration of the strength, a symbol of the progress of human society and civilization.
transcript: 他认为，人类应该同情和救助弱者，同情和救助弱者，是强者的表现，是人类社会进步和文明的象征。

translation: Is it true that people evolved from monkeys?
transcript: 这个人哪，到底是不是猴子变来的？

translation: It is an interesting question.
transcript: 说起这个事儿呢，也比较有趣。

translation: Ten days ago, there was a news in India about Satyapar Singh, a Minister responsible for higher education in the Ministry of Human Ressources Development of India.
transcript: 在十天前，在印度发生了一件新闻，是印度教育部的一个负责高等教育的部长，叫做萨提亚帕尔•辛格。

translation: Minister Singh made a remark, saying that Darwin’s theory of evolution was wrong.
transcript: 这个辛格部长呢，发表了一篇一番言论，他说，达尔文的进化论是错的。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: He said that the theory of evolution should be removed from the school curriculum because no one, whether living in the countryside or cities, had ever seen an ape turning into a man.
transcript: 他说我和我的祖先，无论是生活在农村，还是生活在城市，谁都没看到猿猴变成过人，在印度啊，应该是禁止教授进化论。

translation: More than 2,000 scientists in India unanimously rejected the proposal, calling it a backwards step in human society.
transcript: 印度的学术界，马上就有两千多位科学家联名反对，说这简直就是人类社会的退步。

translation: So how should we look at the relationship between humans and apes?
transcript: 那么我们应该如何地去来看待这个人和猴子的关系呢？

translation: We now know that variation is universal.
transcript: 我们知道，变异呢是普遍存在的。

translation: With the existence of variations, we can representation the relationship between species in a way similar to a family tree.
transcript: 有变异的存在，我们就可以像家谱图那样，来表示物种之间的亲缘关系。

translation: A phylogenetic tree can represent the relationship between species.
transcript: 物种之间的亲缘关系，就可以用进化树来体现。

translation: It is commonly agreed that we are more closely related to our brothers than we are to our cousins.
transcript: 我们知道在一个家族中，通常你会认为，你和亲哥哥要比相比你的堂哥哥，要更近一些。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么？

translation: Because you and your brother have a more recent common ancestor, your father.
transcript: 因为你和你亲哥哥的血缘关系，你往上追，一定是先追到你父亲。

translation: You and your cousin have a less recent common ancestor, your grandfather.
transcript: 但是你跟你堂哥哥的关系，那你一定要追追追踪到你祖父。

translation: Humans and apes are far less related than you and your cousin are.
transcript: 人和猴子的关系呢，要比这个远得多。

translation: On average, the timescale between our grandfather and us is less than one hundred years.
transcript: 一般的一个家族，人也就人从自己到祖父，不超过一百年。

translation: How far back does the last common ancestor that humans had with apes trace back to?
transcript: 那么猕猴呢，和人的时间差多少呢？

translation: About 25 to 30 million years.
transcript: 两千五百万年到三千万年。

translation: The common ancestor of human and apes is at A , while the common ancestor of human and chimpanzee is at C.
transcript: 人和猕猴的共同祖先在A那个地方，人和黑猩猩共同祖先是在C那个地方。

translation: How far back in time is C?
transcript: C那个地方有多长时间呢？

translation: About five to seven million years.
transcript: 这个时间应该是五个百万年到七个百万年。

translation: In The Descent of Man and Selection In Relation To Sex.
transcript: 达尔文在《人类的起源》里头讲。

translation: Darwin said the common ancestor of human and great apes, dryopithecus, lived about seven million years ago.
transcript: 人和类人猿的共同祖先森林古猿，大概在七个百万年。

translation: To make an analogy, to say that humans evolved from monkeys is as ridiculous as to say that we descent from our cousins.
transcript: 如果你说人是由猴子变来的，我们可以做一个类比，那它要比你说你是由你堂哥变来的，那还荒谬。

translation: That is to say, no existing species descents from another existing species.
transcript: 所以说，没有现在任何一个生物，是由现在的另外一个生物演变而来的。

translation: Although we cannot say that turtles descent from frogs.
transcript: 正如你不能说乌龟是青蛙变来的。

translation: We can say that they have a common ancestor and descent from the common ancestor.
transcript: 但是，你能够说它们俩有共同祖先，它们是由它们的共同祖先而来。

translation: Then, has Darwin's theory of evolution gone out of date?
transcript: 那么进化论，讲了这么多，进化论是不是就已经过时了呢？

translation: We often see news in various news media and on websites claiming that Darwin's theory of evolution has been overthrown
transcript: 我们经常会在不同的新闻媒体、网站去看到，什么达尔伦的进化论被推翻啦。

translation: Or Darwin subverted his own theory.
transcript: 还有就是这个，达尔文自己把自己的理论推翻啦。

translation: The theory was said to be either overthrown or subverted.
transcript: 不是推翻了，就是颠覆。

translation: How can we make our own judgement?
transcript: 啊这个时候我们应该做一个什么样的判断呢？

translation: It can be done in a simple way.
transcript: 非常非常的简单。

translation: We should first ask a few questions.
transcript: 只要有几个问题还在那里。

translation: Is variation universal?
transcript: 变异是不是普遍存在的？

translation: Does the struggle for survival still exist?
transcript: 生存斗争是不是还存在？

translation: Does struggle for survival lead to survival of the fittest?
transcript: 生存斗争的结果是不是导致适者生存？

translation: If the answer to these three aspects is still "yes", then Darwin's theory of evolution is not yet outdated.
transcript: 如果这三方面的答案还是“是”的话，那么达尔文的进化论就没有过时。

translation: Another concept related to Darwin's theory of evolution is "evolution".
transcript: 还有呢，就是跟达尔文的进化论相关的就是“进化”这一词，叫evolution。

translation: As we all know, this term did not occur in On the Origin of Species, but this book led everyone to accept the idea of ​​evolution.
transcript: 我们大家知道，达尔文在《物种起源》里头并没有用这个词，但是达尔文的《物种起源》让大家很快地接受了进化的理念。

translation: Therefore, as long as journals are still publishing articles about evolution, then the theory of evolution is not yet overthrown.
transcript: 如果跟“进化”这个词相关的杂志依然还在发表着文章，那么应该说进化论就没有被推翻。

translation: Does this mean that Darwin's theory of evolution is flawless?
transcript: 是不是这样说，达尔文的进化论就一点毛病都没有了呢？

translation: No, it is not.
transcript: 也不是。

translation: Darwin was very "frank" about the theory's shortcomings.
transcript: 啊达尔文对自己呀的学说有自知之明。

translation: In the chapter of Laws of Variation, he wrote, "I do not know anything about the laws of variation."
transcript: 他在《变异的法则》那一章上，就写到“我，对变异的法则一无所知”。

translation: How straightforward!
transcript: 多么直白。

translation: The theory's shortcomings were later compensated by Mendel's discovery of laws of inheritance.
transcript: 那么他这样的一个写法，是被后来孟德尔遗传规律重新发现，给弥补了。

translation: After the publication of On the Origin of Species, the idea of evolution was widely accepted.
transcript: 还有呢，达尔文的《物种起源》发表之后，大家都都对他的进化理论非常的认可。

translation: But few showed interests in the idea of selection.
transcript: 但是大家对选择理论，不太感兴趣。

translation: Many people thought the principles of natural selection were problematic.
transcript: 很多人是认为选择是有问题的。

translation: They accepted the idea of evolution but rejected the principles of natural selection.
transcript: 我接受你的进化思想，但是你的选择是有问题的。

translation: The principles of natural selection did not gain recognition until a new theory of evolution, modern synthesis was developed fifty years after Darwin's death, uniting Mendelian genetics and Darwinian evolution.
transcript: 一直到达尔文去世之后，五十年，是当群体遗传学的发展和进化论结合起来了，形成了一个新的流派，叫做现代综合论，才让选择学说落地生根，大家广为认可。

translation: We all know that Darwin's work did not involve the molecules, unlike the genomics today.
transcript: 我们大家知道，达尔文那个时代他不会做分子，哪像现在的做做基因组。

translation: The molecular part was then made up for by neutral theory of molecular evolution by Kimura Motoo and other researchers in this field.
transcript: 分子这部分的理论，就由木村资生的中性理论，以及后面的人近中性理论所弥补。

translation: Modern genetic analysis has actually taken new Darwinism to a new level.
transcript: 现代我们做基因，实际上是将新选择主义推向了一个新的高度。

translation: New evidences keep emerging.
transcript: 所有新的证据在不断地发现。

translation: Traditional branches of biology such as morphology, taxonomy, paleontology, developmental biology and biogeography, propelled by new findings in molecular biology, genomics, and bioinformatics, are advancing our understanding of evolution.
transcript: 那么传统的形态学、分类学、古生物学、发育学、呃生物地理学，在分子生物学、基因组学和生物信息学的推动下，正在改变着我们对进化的一点一点的认识。

translation: One of my former students went to the Galapagos Islands this year.
transcript: 我以前的一个学生，今年他到了加拉帕戈斯群岛。

translation: He saw elephant tortoises, iguanas and Galapagos penguins, the species found north near the equator.
transcript: 他也看到了那个象龟，看到了那个鬣蜥，他呢，还看到了最贴近贴近赤道的加拉帕戈斯企鹅。

translation: What he saw most was darwin's finches, a plethora of evolutionary studies.
transcript: 他看到最多的，是达尔文的就是进化论的“金苹果”，叫做地雀。

translation: Darwin’s original speculation on finches has been proved by genomic findings.
transcript: 关于地雀，科学家们已经能够用基因组的方法，很好地证明了达尔文当初的设想。

translation: These finches evolve rapidly, a process referred as adaptive radiation.
transcript: 那么这些地雀，是快速地辐射进化。

translation: These finches have specialized beak shapes depending on their primary source of nutrition and occupy various ecological niches.
transcript: 它的喙喙形是差异很大的，每一种地雀吃不同的食物，而且占据着不同的生态位。

translation: Scientists have also discovered that there is a species of geospiza that is mixed-breed.
transcript: 科学家呢还发现，有一种地雀是杂交起源。

translation: This finding was published on Nature.
transcript: 这个工作呢是发表在Nature上的。

translation: There was another legendary story about an amazing land in Galapagos Islands.
transcript: 也正是在加拉帕戈斯群岛，这样一块儿神奇的土地，诞生也诞生了一段非常非常有趣的传奇。

translation: Professor Grants and his wife, a divine couple of scientists from Princeton, observed finches here for 40 years.
transcript: 一对儿呢科学家的夫妇，人们号称，这是科学界的神雕侠侣，普林斯顿大学的格兰特夫妇，在这个地方观察地雀四十年。

translation: Their latest research showed if one species of finches mated with another species resident on the island, this could give rise to a new species within three generations.
transcript: 他们一个最新的研究成果，是两种地雀杂交，能够产生一种新的地雀，只需要用三代，就可以产生新种。

translation: This new species are distinctive in their song, beak size and shape.
transcript: 这种新种，它是在鸟鸣、在这个喙、在体型上，都有和亲种有明显的差异。

translation: It has formed a very independent and complicated bird lineage.
transcript: 它已经形成了一个非常独立的大鸟谱系。

translation: If Darwin were still alive, he would probably be amazed too.
transcript: 如果达尔文，他能够感受到的话，那么对他来说，应该也是一个惊奇。

translation: He would also be amazed by the speed of formation of this new species, it could be realized within just three generations.
transcript: 因为他也难以想象，原来物种形成的速度居然有这么快，短短的三代，就可以完成。

translation: Today we talked about the misunderstandings towards Darwin and his theory of evolution.
transcript: 我们在这里来回顾一下，达尔文和他的进化论，有那么多的误解。

translation: Through the reflection on these misunderstandings.
transcript: 那么我们反思这些误解的时候。

translation: We are able to understand that Darwin's contribution does not lie in what he has overthrown.
transcript: 我们就会明白，达尔文他的贡献，并不在于他是不是推翻了什么。

translation: Although technically he has challenged creationism, lots of people still believe in God.
transcript: 比如他在学术界上，他已经推翻了神创论，但是在民间上，还有很多人去信奉上帝。

translation: Darwin’s greatest contribution was to have changed how we perceive the natural world and ourselves.
transcript: 达尔文最大的贡献，是改变了我们认识自然世界和我们自身的看法。

translation: The beauty of Darwin's theory is that he has had to the evidence in place even before it gets questioned.
transcript: 达尔文的过人之处在于，当我们在质疑某项事物的时候，他已经准备好了反驳什么或者支持什么的证据。

translation: Darwin was so frank and confident about this theory.
transcript: 达尔文对他的学说是超然自信。

translation: His principles of natural selection were tested and selected by history.
transcript: 他提出了自然选择学说，而他的选择学说，也受到了历史的检验，也被历史选择下来。

translation: Thank you.
